intro: Zieria compacta, commonly known as the dwarf zieria, is a small shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Zieria compacta is well adapted to rocky or sandy soils and is often found in heathland environments.
